intro: Ceropegia adolfi, commonly known as the African violet or velvet plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often white or pink in color. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia adolfi is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
